intro: Celastrus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved staff-vine, is a climbing plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Botanically, it belongs to the family Celastraceae and is known for its rapid growth and adaptability to various soil types.
